intro: Senecio ferruglii, commonly known as the rusty groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as desert plains and rocky soils. Its yellow flowers bloom in the summer, attracting various pollinators like bees and butterflies. Senecio ferruglii is generally drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun conditions.
